articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Various Domains of South Hamgyong Province
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Various Domains of South Hamgyong Province
						

					Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to different domains of Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province which takes the lead in the vigorous drive for great surge under the torch kindled in the province.
					
					 First he went to the Water-Supply Settling Basin of the February 8 Vinalon Complex,
					
					 Very pleased to see newly changed scenery of the basin overflowing with clean water including retaining wall, waterway wall, pumping station, sluice facility and handrails, he gave a high appreciation of servicepersons' heroic feats.
					
					 I came to take to heart again the irrefutable truth that we can win only victory despite any trial and adversity and work miracles of the history thanks to the revolutionary soldier spirit, the offensive spirit of "at a breath" cherished by the servicepersons through their sacred struggle to be remembered by the country and the people and to remain long in the history, he said. 
					
					 The second leg of his guidance was the Sub-plant of the Ryongsong Machine Complex.
					
					 Touring processing shop, heat treatment workteam and other parts of the sub-plant, he acquainted himself in detail with technological updating and production there.
					
					 Seeing CNC machine tools newly installed at the processing shop, he said with pride that we can put the industrial establishments on a modern basis as we please because we have the powerful Ryonha General Machinery Plant.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction at the CNC spinning machine manufactured by the workers and technicians of the sub-plant with their concerted efforts.
					
					 It is very good that the sub-plant has turned arrangement of equipment by kinds and processes to good account to reduce production area, shorten the product processing time and raise production efficiency, he said.
					
					 He also gave appreciation of the fact that the sub-plant has reduced the cost price of material heat treatment to the maximum by updating the heat treatment process through a vigorous technical innovation campaign. 
					
					 He advanced tasks to be fulfilled by the sub-plant.
					
					 He underscored the need to speed up the work for putting the production process on a modern and scientific basis and positively introduce advanced technology.
					
					 He also stressed that in order to turn out more quality advanced machines, it is important to steadily raise the level of technical skill of producers and, simultaneously, ensure the effective production organization and direction so that officials, workers and technicians can aspire to new things all the time.
					
					 He had a picture taken with labor innovators. 
					
					 The third leg of his guidance was the Sinhungsan Chemical Factory.
					
					 He went round the general control room and other places of the factory to learn about its technological updating and production.
					
					 While looking round modernly renovated production processes, he expressed satisfaction over the fact that the officials and employees of the factory successfully carried out huge project with their own efforts and technology and are now putting the production on a steady basis. 
					
					 The chemical industry is of great importance in strengthening the economic independence of the country and improving the people's living standard, he said, expressing belief that the officials and party members and other workers of the factory would fully discharge their honorable mission and duty.
					
					  He gave field guidance to Hamhung Knitting Mill.
					
					 He visited a room devoted to the history of the mill where he looked at the meaningful photo of President Kim Il Sung giving field guidance to the mill in May 1957 and materials indicative of the shining path covered by the mill under the wise guidance of the WPK.
					
					 Looking round various places of the mill including the weaving shop, he acquainted himself with knitwear production.
					
					 Carefully watching the operation of knitting equipment, he grasped the technical specifications of machines and daily production per machine.
					
					 He learned in detail about the specific features and quality of the knitted cloth made of vinalon, fiber of our own invention and other chemical fibers.
					
					 He advanced the tasks before the mill. 
					
					 He saw to it that a measure was taken to equip the mill with high-speed knitting machines, stressing the need to put the production processes on a high modern basis to drastically increase knitwear production and improve their quality.
					
					 Next he dropped in at Hungnam Shoes Factory.
					
					 He went round a sample-display room, a preparation shop, a shoemaking shop and other places of the factory to learn about production.
					
					 Upon hearing that the factory can boost footwear production now that it is supplied with vinyl chloride, raw material needed for shoemaking, by the February 8 Vinalon Complex, he said that the Complex greatly benefits the whole country.
					
					 Carefully watching the patterns and smartness of shoes and learning about their weight, he called on the factory to further raise quality of goods as required by the consumers and trend.
					
					 The factory has a very important duty to fulfill in settling the footwear issue of the people in the province and the east coastal area, he said, putting forth tasks facing the factory. 
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was Songchongang Exports Forwarding Office.
					
					 Touring the seafood processing plant and indoor aquiculture tank and other places Kim Jong Il learned about the production potentials, aquatic products storage and processing.
					
					 He was very pleased to hear that processed marine products are strictly vacuum-packed and goods are delivered to fish shops and several commercial and public service outlets.
					
					 He appreciated the extraction of chitinous acid from crab shells that had previously been disposed of.
					
					 He learned about the production of Nano goods with chitinous acid for various usage by the office together with teachers and researches of Kim Il Sung University and wished them successes through in-depth researches.
					
					 Watching fishes including plaices, crabs and flatfishes that are kept alive in the indoor aquiculture tank, he learned about how long fishes can be stored alive since they were caught in the sea. He instructed officials to supply fresh fishes to the people.
					
					  He also gave field guidance to the vegetable greenhouse newly built in the Hoesang Area Farm in Hamhung City.
					
					 Touring eggplant block and other parts of the house, he learned about its construction and vegetable production.
					
					 He was very pleased with the fact that hothouses based on solar heat have been built there to provide sure guarantee for increasing vegetable production.
					
					 It is especially satisfactory that the house is able to turn out vegetables free from effects of contaminants and dust, he said.  
					
					 He stressed that the greenhouse has an important role to play in improving the diet of Hamhung citizens.
					
					 In order to increase per-hectare yield of hothouse vegetables, he said, it is needed to put production on an intensive basis and vegetable cultivation and management such as supply of water, fertilizer and chemicals and regulation of temperature and humidity on a modern basis.
					
					 He also stressed the need to direct efforts to solving the scientific and technological problem for production of fruit-bearing vegetables in winter season and thus enrich the present success.
					
					 Repeatedly appreciating the greenhouse as very perfect and flawless, he called for making it yield greater result so that inhabitants can get benefits substantially.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., WPK; Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., WPK; Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK; and Ri Jae Il and Pak Pong Ju, first vice department directors of the C.C., WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Attends Events Marking 50th Anniversary of Tanganyika's Independence
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Attends Events Marking 50th Anniversary of Tanganyika's Independence

					Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Tanzania, Friday took part in events held in Dar-Es-Salaam on the 50th anniversary of Tanganyika's independence.
					
					 Present there were Tanzanian President Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete, commanders of the Tanzanian army, personages of various circles, citizens, heads of state and governments and high-ranking delegations of different countries, diplomatic envoys and members of military attaches' corps and representatives of international organizations in Tanzania.
					
					 The events included the review and parade of the columns of the three services and mass games.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Namibian, Mozambican Presidents
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Namibian, Mozambican Presidents

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly who is on an official goodwill visit to Tanzania, met and had friendly talks with Namibian President Hifikepunye Pohamba and Mozambican President Armando Emilio Guebuza separately in Dar Es Salaam Friday.
					
					 Views were exchanged on the development of non-aligned movement and recent international issues.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam also met and had talks with Abdelkader Bensalah, president of the Council of the Nation of Algeria, and the former presidents of Tanzania separately.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets FM of Lesotho
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets FM of Lesotho
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Friday met and had a talk with Mohlabi Kenneth Tsekoa, foreign minister of Lesotho, in Dar Es Salaam.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme Peopleâ€™s Assembly, Friday sent a message of greeting to President Blaise Compaore of Burkina Faso on the 53rd national day.
					
					 Kim in the message wished the president of Burkina Faso greater success in his responsible work for national unity and economic development of the country.

articles.title: JUK Central Committee Denounces S. Korean Conservative Media
articles.content:
JUK Central Committee Denounces S. Korean Conservative Media 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Journalists Union of Korea (JUK) Central Committee Saturday made public a statement denouncing the ultra-right conservative media for resorting to undisguised arbitrary practices under the patronage of the south Korean puppet authorities.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are toughening suppression of progressive media while exploiting reactionary ultra-right conservative media in tiding over the ruling crisis in the face of the people's anti-"government" sentiment. 
					
					 Chosun Ilbo, Choongang Ilbo, Dong-A Ilbo and Maeil Kyongje and other conservative newspapers of south Korean took control of the wired TV channel and began service from Dec. 1 backed by the authorities. 
					
					 In the past the conservative papers deceived people and misled the public opinion by carrying false and deceptive news stories in the papers only. But now they monopolized the wired TV channel, means of a big role in building up public opinion. This created an abnormal situation whereby treachery and injustice insult patriotism and justice in south Korea. 
					
					 South Korean opposition parties and different social strata including media protested against the starting of the wired TV channel describing it as "conservative forces' attempt to monopolize media market", "a gimmick to prolong the remaining days of the present regime" and "a sordid scenario aimed at victory in general election and presidential elections". Other TV broadcasting agencies and newspapers strongly rebuffed the move by denying the production of broadcasting materials and putting blank ads. 
					
					 By use of ultra-right media the puppet authorities seek to build up public opinions in favor of them and tide over the ruling crisis and evade the people's punishment in the National Assembly election and "presidential" elections due next year. 
					
					 The JUK Central Committee in the name of all the journalists and mediapersons of the DPRK bitterly denounced the arbitrariness practiced by the south Korean conservative media as an unpardonable crime abusing justice, truth, mindset and conscience of people and a despicable move to turn south Korean society rightwing and fascist. 
					
					   It went on to say:
					
					 Media is a mouthpiece for justice, conscience and truth and harbinger of the era. 
					
					 If the authorities' moves to grasp media and the arbitrary practices of conservative media agencies following them are overlooked, justice, conscience and truth will be violated and injustice, treachery, confrontation and anti-reunification moves will stalk in south Korea. 
					
					 South Korean mediapersons and other people from all walks of life should never allow the moves of the authorities keen on staying in power by putting media on government payroll and rendering it reactionary, and the hackwork of ultra-right conservative writers. 
					
					 All the mediapersons of south Korea should denounce the authorities' sycophantic, traitorous and fascist confrontation moves against reunification with the just writing brushes, patriotic microphones and radio waves for independence and democracy. They should also decisively shatter the authorities' ambition to remain in office and deal heavy blows to the ultra-right conservative media groups serving the power as a waiting maid. 
					
					 The authorities and conservative media agencies should clearly understand that arbitrariness, deception and intrigues going against the mindset of people will only bring stronger denunciation, protest and miserable end.

articles.title: Delegation of State Maritime Supervisory Bureau Leaves for Moscow
articles.content:
Delegation of State Maritime Supervisory Bureau Leaves for Moscow

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State Maritime Supervisory Bureau led by Director Ko Nung Du, general director of the DPRK Classification Association, left here Saturday to attend the meeting to commentate the 50th anniversary of the International Association of Technical Survey and Classification Institution slated in Moscow.
					
					 A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, came back home the same day after attending the 18th General Meeting of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the 31st International Red Cross Meeting in Geneva, Switzerland.

articles.title: New Children's Books Off Press
articles.content:
New Children's Books Off Press

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The Korea Literature and Art Publishing House brought out new children's books of diverse themes recently.
					
					Among them is a collection of kindergarteners' songs "Sunward Flower", which carries more than 190 songs created in the country since its liberation in 1945. Included in the songs are famous songs created by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 "Korean Rhythm Learning" is a book helpful to musical education in kindergartens.
					
					 "Let Us Remain Alive and Fight to the End" is one of the newly published picture books.

articles.title: Distinctive Program of Servicepersons' Art Performance
articles.content:
Distinctive Program of Servicepersons' Art Performance
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Company soldiers' art performance going on in Pyongyang is characterized by a distinctive program. Before starting to give the performance, they distinguished themselves in the 35th servicepersons' art festival of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The program mirrors servicepersons' militant and heroic spirit, strong faith and mettle. 
					
					 A servicewoman performed a harmonica solo "The Kitchen Wagon Runs", winning enthusiastic applause from audience. 
					
					 Scores of servicepersons played willow flutes to the song "The Homeland Will Always Remember", a theme song of a movie.
					
					 Other performers use empty cartridges to play music reflecting their life in company.
					
					 The audience admire the excellent performance and performers' high artistry.

articles.title: Total Lunar Eclipse to Be Seen from Korea Saturday Night
articles.content:
Total Lunar Eclipse to Be Seen from Korea Saturday Night
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A total lunar eclipse is to be seen from Korea Saturday night.
					
					 The moon rose at 16:58 and will set at 08:05 next morning.
					
					 It will have a partial eclipse from 21:45 and a total one for 49 minutes from 23:07 to 23:56.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Nuclear Threats to DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Nuclear Threats to DPRK
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- U.S. Congress, political parties and military are talking nonsense about "threats" from the DPRK.
					
					 A bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Saturday terms it a reversed theory of "threat", stressing that "threats" come to the DPRK from the U.S. 
					
					 The U.S. has no justification to talk about "threats" from someone, the article says, adding:
					
					 It has systematically posed nuclear threats to the DPRK from long ago.
					
					 Its nuclear blackmail has become pronounced in the new century.
					
					 The Korean people were compelled to live in constant tension, being targeted by the U.S. nukes.
					
					 This was evidenced by the annual nuclear war exercises the U.S. has staged against the DPRK in south Korea and its vicinity by mobilizing huge nuclear preemptive strike means.
					
					 The U.S. theory of "threat" is prompted by its sinister intention.
					
					 It is its calculation that if it puts the Korean Peninsula under its control, it can dominate Northeast Asia and, furthermore, the rest of the world including Asia-Pacific.
					
					 The U.S. persistent nuclear threat will only force the DPRK to bolster its efforts to cope with it. This is an inviolable independent right of the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms "Flexibility of Policy towards North" Variety of "Theory of Principle Adherence"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms "Flexibility of Policy towards North" Variety of "Theory of Principle Adherence"
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The ruling quarters of south Korea recently let loose rubbish that the "flexibility of policy towards north" is for "defusing south-north relations and tensions" and that they "expect the north to respond to their sincere efforts."
					
					 A bylined commentary of Rodong Sinmun Saturday terms the "flexibility of policy towards north" a variety of their theory of "adherence to principle".
					
					 The advertisement of the "flexibility" by the south Korean conservative forces is just a stop-gap measure to tide over political bankruptcy following strong public protest and denunciation inside and outside south Korea, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 They are talking about "flexibility" and the like to give impression that they are interested in improving the inter-Korean relations, but this is no more than a disgusting smile of those who carry daggers in their belts.
					
					 The conservative group is, in actuality, pursuing confrontation with the DPRK and can never cover up its nature.
					
					 Traitors who are intent on confrontation and war will only face stern punishment by history.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Demand Release of Rev. Han Sang Ryol
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Demand Release of Rev. Han Sang Ryol

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, made public a statement on Dec. 8 to condemn the south Korean puppet authorities for having imposed heavy penalty on Rev. Han Sang Ryol.
					
					 The statement noted that the Supreme Court of south Korea sentenced Han, who visited the DPRK on the 10th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration last year, to three years in jail and three years of suspension of qualification by invoking the "National Security Law", an anti-reunification evil law.
					
					 All activities Han did in the DPRK were a patriotic deed conducive to removing a stumbling block to the north-south relations and national reunification and keeping the trend of the June 15 era of reunification, it said.
					
					 The statement vehemently slashed at the anti-national and anti-reunification crime of the south Korean conservative authorities who again totally denied the June 15 joint declaration, a reunification program common to the nation, by imposing such harsh punishment on Rev. Han.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop the suppression of people calling for implementation of the inter-Korean declarations, set free Han unconditionally and totally abrogate the NSL, the fascist law obstructive to independence, democracy and reunification, it urged.

articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries Marked in Peru, Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries Marked in Peru, Russia

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on December 1 and 2 to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero. They included a meeting in Peru and an opening ceremony of Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition in Russia.
					
					 Displayed in the venue of the exhibition were works of peerlessly great men, books and photos on undying feats of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the creative skill of the Korean people.
					
					 The chairperson of the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk and other speakers praised Kim Jong Suk as a guard who ensured the safety of President Kim Il Sung on the highest level, a revolutionary comrade who remained true to his idea and intention and a great mother of Korea who provided a sure guarantee for the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 A deputy director of the Cultural Bureau of the Maritime Territory Administration of Russia said that the exhibition would provide an opportunity for the Russian people to know well about the wisdom and talents of the Korean people who boast of 5,000 year long history and culture. It would also mark an occasion for further developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, he added.
					
					 The curator of the Maritime Territory National Fine Art Museum of Russia noted that the exhibits reflect the Korean people's trust in their leaders.

articles.title: Japan's Ambition for Militarism Exposed by Regional Organization
articles.content:
Japan's Ambition for Militarism Exposed by Regional Organization
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on Dec. 5 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Japan's ambition for militarism".
					
					 Ultra-rightist politicians of Japan thronged to Yasukuni Shrine on August 15 this year, the article said, adding:
					
					 Their visit to the shrine on the anniversary of Korea's liberation from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule was an unpardonable insult and a mockery of the Korean people.
					
					 What enrages the people is that the high-ranking politicians of Japan have openly defended prime war criminals who were executed for their crimes against humanity during World War II.
					
					 The ultra-rightist maniacs have become vocal calling for "reinstating" the honor of those who were buried in the shrine and saying that those who do not visit the shrine "can not be called Japanese." This suggests Japan's attempt to revive militarism has reached the extreme phase.
					
					 Militarist hysteria pervading the Japanese society hints that it is a matter of time for Japan to launch reinvasion of Korea and other Asian countries.
					
					 Japan's attempt to revive militarism will bring its ruin.

articles.title: Putin Rejects Remark of U.S. State Secretary
articles.content:
Putin Rejects Remark of U.S. State Secretary 
						

					 Moscow, December 9 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin harshly criticized the U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton for her reckless remark on Dec. 8.
					
					 The secretary called the election to the State Duma in Russia an unfair one even before receiving information from election observers, he said, adding Clinton "gave a signal" to his opponents. 
					
					 Putin said Russia should defend its sovereignty. 
					
					"We need to think about strengthening the law and holding more responsible those who carry out the task of a foreign government to influence our internal political process," Putin said.

articles.title: Russia Not to Allow NATO's Arbitrary Practices
articles.content:
Russia Not to Allow NATO's Arbitrary Practices
						

					 Moscow, December 9 (KCNA) -- Dmitri Rogozin, permanent representative of Russia to the NATO, in a recent interview with ITAR-TASS expressed the stand of his country not to allow the NATO's arbitrary practices.
					
					 Russia can neither accept nor subscribe to the NATO turning into the West's "surgical knife" cutting alive countries out of its control, he said.
					
					 Russia considers NATO centralism to be unpardonable, he added.

articles.title: Russia Promotes GPS
articles.content:
Russia Promotes GPS

					 Moscow, December 9 (KCNA) -- Russia is pushing ahead with the work to set up Glonas GPS.
					
					 A spokesperson for the Space Industrial Complex of Russia clarified on Dec. 8 that Glonas GPS group is currently using 24 satellites for the purpose.
					
					 So it has become possible to provide position signals nonstop on a global scale.

articles.title: China Rejects West's Accusation: FM Spokesman
articles.content:
China Rejects West's Accusation: FM Spokesman
						

					 Beijing, December 9 (KCNA) -- Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Hong Lei at a regular press briefing on Dec. 8 rejected the West's accusation against China.
					
					 Some Western media described China's engagement with Africa as "neo-colonialism" which is untruthful, Hong said.
					
					 Hong noted that it is the common obligation of the international community to promote the sustainable development of Africa's agricultural sector.
					
					 Hong urged those countries that actually possess vast land to listen to the voice of Africa and contribute to addressing the food security of the continent with real actions.

articles.title: Iran's Government Calls for Enhancing Role of Students
articles.content:
Iran's Government Calls for Enhancing Role of Students 
						

					 Tehran, December 9 (KCNA) -- The minister of Science, Research and Technology of Iran in a message on Wednesday called for enhancing the role of students.
					
					 The Iranian students had an active role in defending the Islamic Republic rights in the international community.
					
					 Being equipped with the latest scientific, technological and research tools is the main job of the revolutionary students of Iran in defending the country against the imposed soft war of arrogant powers, he added.

articles.title: PLO Censures U.S. Obstructions
articles.content:
PLO Censures U.S. Obstructions
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A senior official of the Palestinian Liberation Organization in a press conference on Tuesday censured the U.S. for obstructing Palestine for pursuing UN membership.
					
					 The U.S. is forcing Palestine to resume direct negotiations with Israel and, at the same time, blocking a UN Security Council vote on Palestinian statehood, he charged.
					
					 The Palestinian National Authority will not resume direct negotiations with Israel unless preconditions are met, he said. "We will continue to pursue for membership at the United Nations."

articles.title: AU Member Nations Cooperate in Trade
articles.content:
AU Member Nations Cooperate in Trade 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Member nations of the African Union are strengthening cooperation in trade.
					
					 A meeting of trade ministers of the AU was recently held in Accra, Ghana with over 30 trade ministers and senior officials of Africa attending.
					
					 Discussed there were the matters of calling for the harmonization of standards, ensuring that tariffs were harmonized, adopting similar processes and procedure so that it becomes easy to move across one border to another, among many others and of improving infrastructure in favor of trade development.
					
					 It adopted a roadmap for an African Free Trade Area to be achieved within the next six years.

articles.title: Cambodia's Largest Hydroelectric Dam Begins Operation
articles.content:
Cambodia's Largest Hydroelectric Dam Begins Operation
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Cambodia's largest dam, Kamchay hydroelectric dam, with a capacity of 193 megawatt, was officially put into operation in Kampot Province on Wednesday.
					
					 The government is planning to build four more hydroelectric dams by 2015.

articles.title: Indonesia to Take Step for Settling Food Problem
articles.content:
Indonesia to Take Step for Settling Food Problem
						

					Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian agriculture ministry is seeking for 500,000 hectares of land to boost soybean production up to the self sufficiency level of 2.2 million tons per year from last year's 907,030 tons per year, the minister said on Tuesday.
					
					 Indonesia's soybean production was forecast to decrease by 36,960 tons to 870,070 tons this year, the Statistic Bureau of this country announced.

articles.title: Myanmar Plans Strategic Fight against HIV/AIDS
articles.content:
Myanmar Plans Strategic Fight against HIV/AIDS 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Myanmar has worked out a national strategic plan (2011-15) to fight HIV/AIDS in the next five years.
					
					 The plan was developed in consultation with all key stakeholders as a roadmap to achieve universal access to HIV prevention, care treatment for those in need and reach the zero targets (zero new HIV infections, zero discrimination and zero AIDS related deaths) in Myanmar by 2015 ultimately.
					
					 According to the plan the government will use mass media for information services for the danger of AIDS and intensify the medical treatment of AIDS cases.

articles.title: Israeli Army Arrests 21 Palestinians in West Bank
articles.content:
Israeli Army Arrests 21 Palestinians in West Bank
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Israeli army on Wednesday arrested 21 Palestinians in the West Bank, Palestinian sources said.

articles.title: Most Greeks Suffer Dramatic Income Decline
articles.content:
Most Greeks Suffer Dramatic Income Decline

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The wide majority of Greek households have suffered from dramatic income decline amidst deep recession in 2011 due to austerity measures implemented by the government to overcome an acute debt crisis, according to a new poll released on Tuesday. 
					
					 An 88 percent of Greek citizens said that their income declined dramatically this year, and 80.8 percent of the respondents predicted further pain next year.

articles.title: Japanese Express Concern about Country's Economy
articles.content:
Japanese Express Concern about Country's Economy
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Japanese are raising voices of concern about the country's economy.
					
					 According to the nationwide poll made public by Mainichi Shimbun on Dec. 5, 84 percent of the respondents deplored that during the recent one year the country's economy took a sharp turn for the worse.

articles.title: Sugar Cane Harvest Starts in Cuba
articles.content:
Sugar Cane Harvest Starts in Cuba
						

					 Havana, December 9 (KCNA) -- Harvest of sugar cane started in Cuba recently.
					
					 A total of 46 sugar factories are being involved in the 2011-2012 cane harvest.
					
					 It is predicted to produce 3-4 million tons of sugar in this period.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Thailand and Colombia
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Thailand and Colombia

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- In Thailand a total of 677 people were confirmed dead and three people were missing in the floods that have inundated the upper part of the country for about four months, the Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Department reported on Wednesday.
					
					 Ayutthaya has the highest death toll where 139 people were killed by flood. 
					
					 The government is taking relief measures.
					
					 Meanwhile, at least seven people were killed in a landslide Monday in rural areas of Tolima province in central-eastern Colombia, local authorities said.
					
					 According to Colombia's Risk Management Office, disasters in the ongoing rainy season have left 120 people dead, 21 missing and 105 injured.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Japan
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.0 on the Richter scale jolted the east coast of Honshu, Japan on Wednesday. 
					
					 The epicenter was the waters off the coast.

articles.title: Cooperation among Developing Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Developing Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Malaysia and Qatar on Dec. 5 agreed to set up an investment fund in a bid to boost bilateral economic cooperation.
					
					 Sudan and Qatar signed six agreements on bilateral cooperation in mining industry, agriculture, medicine and other fields on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il orienta unidades de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il orienta unidades de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur

					Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio en el terreno las labores de varias ramas de la ciudad de Hamhung que marcha en la delantera de gran auge con el fervor de Hamnam.
					
					En primer lugar, recorrio el deposito de sedimentacion para el suministro de aguas del Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero.
					
					Mirando complacido el paisaje del deposito de aguas limpias en que se han renovado el muro de contencion, la estacion de bombeo, los equipos de esclusa y la baranda, evaluo altamente las proezas heroicas de los oficiales y soldados del EPC que cumplieron la obra de reconstruccion.
					
					Volvemos a constar la verdad de que podemos salir siempre victoriosos bajo cualesquier pruebas y adversidades y crear milagros de la historia, gracias al espiritu revolucionario de los militares y al de ofensiva a modo de relampago que adquirieron nuestros oficiales y soldados en el curso de su sagrada lucha que quedara en la memoria de la patria y el pueblo siendo registrada en la historia, dijo.
					
					Su proximo destino fue la fabrica filial del Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong. 
					
					Recorriendo el taller de elaboracion, la brigada de tratamiento termico y otros lugares de la fabrica, se cercioro del estado de reconstruccion tecnica y de produccion.
					
					Al ver las maquinas herramientas CNC instaladas nuevamente en el taller de elaboracion, dijo orgulloso que gracias a la poderosa base de maquinaria Ryonha, ahora se hizo posible realizar facilmente la modernizacion de fabricas y empresas.
					
					Luego de ver una maquina CNC hecha por los obreros y tecnicos de la fabrica uniendo las fuerzas, la evaluo de magnifica.
					
					Es muy loable que la fabrica haya elevado la eficiencia de produccion reduciendo el area de produccion y el tiempo de elaboracion, al ubicar apropiadamente los equipos segun sus versiones y procesos en que necesitan, senalo.
					
					Aprecio tambien el hecho de que la fabrica redujo considerablemente el costo de tratamiento termico de los materiales al modernizar el proceso correspondiente mediante el movimiento de innovacion tecnica.
					
					El Dirigente presento las tareas que incumben a la fabrica filial.
					
					Hay que acelerar la modernizacion y el acondicionamiento cientifico de los procesos de produccion e introducir ampliamente las tecnologias avanzadas, apunto.
					
					Indico que para producir mucho mas maquinas modernas de buena calidad, es preciso elevar constantemente el nivel tecnico y la calificacion de los productores y organizar la produccion de modo que los funcionarios, obreros y tecnicos emprendan incesantemente lo nuevo.
					
					Finalmente, se retrato con los innovadores laborales. 
					
					El estuvo seguidamente en la Fabrica Quimica de Sinhungsan. 
					
					  Recorrio varios lugares como sala de control general haciendo conocimiento del estado de renovacion tecnica y de produccion.
					
					  Tras pasar revista a los modernizados procesos productivos, se puso satisfecho de que los funcionarios y empleados de la fabrica normalizaran la produccion luego de cumplir exitosamente la enorme obra de construccion con las fuerzas y tecnicas propias.
					
					  Indicando que la industria quimica tiene capital importancia en afianzar la independencia economica del pais y mejorar la vida del pueblo, expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios, militantes del partido y trabajadores de la fabrica cumpliran con toda su mision honrosa y deber.
					
					  A continuacion, visito la Fabrica de Tricotaje de Hamhung.
					
					  En la sala de presentacion del historial, vio la foto significativa del Presidente Kim Il Sung dirigiendo la fabrica en mayo de 1957 y los datos referentes a la trayectoria orgullosa que recorrio la fabrica bajo la sabia direccion del partido.
					
					  Averiguo el estado de produccion de tejidos de punto recorriendo el taller de tejido y varios puntos de la fabrica.
					
					  Observando atentamente el estado de funcionamiento de los equipos que tejen las telas de punto de diversos tipos, se informo de sus especificaciones y de la cantidad de produccion diaria por equipo.
					
					  Estudio las peculiaridades y la calidad de las telas de punto hechas con el vinalon Juche y las fibras quimicas y presento las tareas que tiene que cumplir la fabrica.
					
					  Diciendo que se debe realizar en alto nivel la modernizacion de procesos productivos para aumentar trascendentalmente la produccion de tejidos de punto y elevar la calidad de estos productos, tomo las medidas para proveer a la fabrica de los equipos de tricotaje mas rapidos.
					
					  Seguidamente, oriento la Fabrica de Zapatos de Hungnam.
					
					  Sobre todo, se informo como marcha la produccion  recorriendo la sala de muestras, el taller de preparacion, el de fabricacion de calzados y varios lugares.
					
					  Cuando se informo de que la produccion de cloruro de vinilo en el Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero permitio suministrar las materias primas de calzados y aumentar la produccion, senalo que todas las unidades se benefician ya de ese complejo.
					
					  Hay que elevar mas la calidad de los zapatos conforme a la demanda y tendencia de los consumidores, dijo examinando minuciosamente la forma, las apariencias y hasta el peso de los zapatos hechos en la fabrica.
					
					  Apuntando que la Fabrica de Zapatos de Hungnam tiene un deber muy importante en resolver el problema de calzados de los habitantes de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur y la zona litoral del Mar Este, presento las tareas que se presentan a ella. 
					
					  La Empresa de Expedicion de Articulos de Exportacion Songchongang ha sido el penultimo destino del Dirigente.
					
					Pasando revista a varios puntos de la empresa, incluyendo la fabrica de procesamiento de productos maritimos y el criadero bajo techo, el se cercioro de la base productiva de la empresa y del estado de conservacion y procesamiento de los productos maritimos.
					
					Se mostro muy complacido al recibir el parte de que los productos se empaquetan al vacio y se suministran a las pescaderias y otros establecimientos de la red comercial.
					
					Evaluo especialmente la extraccion del acido quitinoso de las cascaras de cangrejo que se desechaban anteriormente.
					
					En colaboracion con los profesores e investigadores de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, la empresa produce con el acido quitinoso los nano-productos con diversos usos.
					
					Informado de ello, formulo votos por hacer que la empresa logre buenos resultados al profundizar la investigacion.
					
					Contemplando peces en el criadero bajo techo, el Dirigente averiguo cuanto tiempo se puede conservarlos vivos desde la captura en el mar e instruyo suministrar al pueblo los pescados frescos.
					
					Finalmente, visito los invernaderos de verduras nuevamente construidos en la Granja Zonal de Hoesang de la ciudad de Hamhung.
					
					Recorriendo varios puntos, averiguo el estado de construccion y produccion de verduras.
					
					Se alegro mucho de que se haya dado la garantia de incrementar la produccion de vegetales gracias al acondicionamiento de invernaderos solares sin otros medios especificos de calefaccion.
					
					Lo que me agrada mas es que aqui pueden producir las verduras descontaminadas apartandolas de sustancias contaminantes y polvos, dijo.
					
					Los invernaderos construidos en la Granja Zonal de Hoesang ocupan un lugar importante en el mejoramiento de la vida alimentaria de los ciudadanos de Hamhung, recalco.
					
					Hay que intensificar la produccion y modernizar el cultivo de verduras y la gestion como el suministro de aguas, abonos y agroquimicos, la regulacion de temperatura y humedad para incrementar el rendimiento por hectarea en los invernaderos, preciso.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de ampliar los exitos de ahora al esforzarse por solucionar los problemas cientifico-tecnicos que se presentan en producir las verduras frutales en el invierno.
					
					Volviendo a calificar de perfectos los invernaderos, el Dirigente encomendo encarecidamente que los operaran bien para que los habitantes puedan beneficiarse realmente de ellos.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buro Politico y jefa de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kwak Pom Gi, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, Ri Jae Il y Pak Pong Ju, primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de grupo artistico de unidad 324 de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de grupo artistico de unidad 324 de EPC
						

					Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio la funcion del grupo de propaganda artistica de la gran unidad combinada 324 del EPC. 
					
					Se presentaron en la escena el quinteto femenino "Gloria a nuestro gran partido", el solo masculino "Cuentalo, el camino del Songun", el quinteto con guitarra "De un salto", el coro comico "Nos miran", el coro mixto "Nuestro ejercito y nuestro pueblo", el solo femenino "Arirang resonado en Jiansanfeng", el coro "Cancion de la defensa de la Patria" y otras piezas. 
					
					A traves de la funcion, los ejecutantes mostraron el poderio invencible del ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu formado como destacamento sin rival y reflejaron la fidelidad de los oficiales y soldados del EPC que viven los dias de servicio militar con la anoranza hacia el Comandante Supremo. 
					
					Al mismo tiempo, manifestaron los rasgos ideo-espirituales de los militares de la gran unidad combinada, quines hacen preparativos de combate dia y noche, observando con alta vigilancia las maniobras provocativas de los enemigos. 
					
					El Comandante Supremo se mostro muy satisfecho de que los miembros del grupo de propaganda artistica hayan ofrecido la funcion magnifica de alto valor ideo-artistico con las piezas de mucho significado cognoscitivo y educativo que reflejan vividamente la inagotable fuerza espiritual y las nobles cualidades morales de nuestro ejercito que marcha a pasos firmes con la firme concepcion del lider y de la revolucion y lleno del optimismo y alegria, y evaluo de alto el exito de la funcion. 
					
					Esta funcion es mejor entre otras piezas que vio en varias ocasiones, dijo y volvio a apreciarla y transmitio su saludo cordial a los creadores y artistas. 
					
					Los ejecutantes tienen las habilidades artisticas de alto nivel y es perfecta tanto la insistencia ideologica de todas las piezas como su contenido que refleja bien la vida de las masas militares, indico. 
					
					El Comandante Supremo expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que en adelante tambien los miembros del grupo de propaganda artistica desarrollaran dinamicamente las actividades de propaganda artistica de caracter revolucionario y combativo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam participa en acto por independencia de Tanganyika
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam participa en acto por independencia de Tanganyika
						

					Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, de visita oficial y de amistad en la Republica Unida de Tanzania, participo el dia 9 en el acto conmemorativo por el 50o aniversario de la independencia de Tanganyika.
					
					Tuvieron lugar en Dar-Es-Salaam variados eventos conmemorativos como la revista y el desfile de las columnas de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas, y la gimnasia masiva.
					
					Estuvieron presentes alli el presidente tanzanio Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete, los comandantes de las fuerzas armadas, las personalidades de diversos estratos, los ciudadanos, los jefes de Estado y gobierno y las delegaciones de alto rango de varios paises, los representantes diplomaticos, los miembros del Cuerpo de Agregados militares y los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales acreditados en ese pais africano.

articles.title: UPC denuncia arbitrariedad de medios de prensa de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
UPC denuncia arbitrariedad de medios de prensa de Sur de Corea

					Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de Periodistas de Corea hizo publica el dia 10 la siguiente declaracion de condena a las arbitrariedades de medios de prensa ultraderechistas y conservadores del Sur de Corea que se tornan mas abiertas bajo el amparo de la banda titere.
					
					En estos dias, la banda titere surcoreana recrudece la represion contra los medios de prensa progresistas, mientras que actua con frenesi para aplacar la opinion publica antigubernamental y liberarse de la crisis de su gobernacion utilizando los medios de prensa ultraderechistas y reaccionarios.
					
					Como resultado, "Chosun Ilbo", "Choongang Ilbo", "Dong-A Ilbo" y "Maeil Kyongje", editoriales de periodicos ultraderechistas, se apoderaron hasta el canal de TV en cable amparados por las autoridades titeres y comenzaron a emitir la radiodifusion a partir del primer dia pasado.
					
					Como consecuencia, estas editoriales, que con las falacias, mentiras y artimanas enganaban y desviaban hasta la fecha la opinion publica, acaparan y controlan a su antojo desde ahora la TV que juega importante rol en la creacion de la opinion social, razon por la cual ocurre en la parte surena de Corea una anormal circunstancia en que lo antipatriotico insulta a lo patriotico y la injusticia, a la justicia.
					
					Los partidos opositores, la capa de medios de prensa y otros sectores sociales denuncian la apertura de la emision de TV en cable calificandolo de un "intento de monopolizar el mercado de prensa de las fuerzas conservadoras", una "ardid para prolongar la existencia del presente poder" y una "intencion maligna con la mirada a las elecciones generales y presidenciales" y libran una lucha protestante. Ademas, las emisoras de TV y las editoriales reaccionan fuertemente negando la redaccion de articulos de radiodifusion e insertando el anuncio blanco, etc.
					
					Tal conducta de la banda titere persigue el maligno intento de liberarse de la crisis de su gobernacion induciendo la opinion publica a su favor y evadir la sentencia publica en las elecciones parlamentarias y presidenciales que tendran lugar el ano siguiente.
					
					El CC del UPC denuncia severamente en nombre de todos los periodistas y los hombres de prensa de la parte nortena de Corea las arbitrariedades de los medios de prensa ultraderechistas que actuan a su antojo bajo el amparo de la banda titere, calificandolas de imperdonable crimen que aplasta la justicia y la verdad, la opinion publica y la conciencia, y de astuta maniobra destinada a convertir la sociedad surcoreana en una ultraderechista y fascista.
					
					La prensa es el portavoz de la justicia, la conciencia y la verdad, asi como el precursor de la epoca.
					
					Si se dejan intactas las maniobras de la banda titere tendentes a controlar los medios de prensa, y las arbitrariedades de los medios de prensa ultraderechistas y conservadores serviles a ella, se exterminaran en el Sur de Corea la justicia, la conciencia y la verdad y reinaran solo la injusticia y la vendepatria, el enfrentamiento y la antireunificacion.
					
					Los hombres de prensa y los habitantes de distintos estratos del Sur de Corea no deben permitir ni un minimo las maniobras de la camarilla titere y de los escritores comercializados ultraderechistas y conservadores encaminadas a retomar el poder convirtiendo los medios de prensa en los venales y reaccionarios.
					
					Todos los hombres de prensa del Sur de Corea deben revelar y denunciar las tentativas serviles, vendepatrias, fascistas y anti-reunificacion de la banda titere con sus pinceles de justicia, microfonos patrioticos y radiodifusion independiente y democratica, frustrar rotundamente la ambicion de retomar el poder y dar un golpe fuerte a los medios de prensa ultraderechistas y conservadoros que  sirven de manera vergonzosa a la banda titere.
					
					La banda titere y los medios de prensa ultraderechistas y conservadoros deben darse clara cuenta de que con las arbitrariedades, brutalidades, mentiras y tergiversaciones, solo provocaran la mayor condena y protesta del pueblo y aceleraran su fin catastrofico.
